entry.name: resizable
entry.desc: Change the size of an element using the mouse

longdesc.p: The jQuery UI Resizable plugin makes selected elements resizable (meaning they have draggable resize handles). You can specify one or more handles as well as min and max width and height.
All callbacks (start,stop,resize) receive two arguments: The original browser event and a prepared ui object.
This interaction requires some functional CSS, otherwise it won't work. If you build a custom theme, use the interaction's specific CSS file as a starting point.

option.name: alsoResize
option.desc: Resize these elements synchronous when resizing.

option.name: animate
option.desc: Animates to the final size after resizing.

option.name: animateDuration
option.desc: Duration time for animating, in milliseconds. Other possible values: 'slow', 'normal', 'fast'.

option.name: aspectRatio
option.desc: If set to true, resizing is constrained by the original aspect ratio. Otherwise a custom aspect ratio can be specified, such as 9 / 16, or 0.5.

option.name: autoHide
option.desc: If set to true, automatically hides the handles except when the mouse hovers over the element.

option.name: cancel
option.desc: Prevents resizing if you start on elements matching the selector.

option.name: containment
option.desc: Constrains resizing to within the bounds of the specified element. Possible values: 'parent', 'document', a DOMElement, or a Selector.

option.name: delay
option.desc: Tolerance, in milliseconds, for when resizing should start. If specified, resizing will not start until after mouse is moved beyond duration. This can help prevent unintended resizing when clicking on an element.

option.name: disabled
option.desc: Disables the resizable if set to true.

option.name: distance
option.desc: Tolerance, in pixels, for when resizing should start. If specified, resizing will not start until after mouse is moved beyond distance. This can help prevent unintended resizing when clicking on an element.

option.name: ghost
option.desc: If set to true, a semi-transparent helper element is shown for resizing.

option.name: grid
option.desc: Snaps the resizing element to a grid, every x and y pixels. Array values: [x, y]

option.name: handles
option.desc:
If specified as a string, should be a comma-split list of any of the following: 'n, e, s, w, ne, se, sw, nw, all'. The necessary handles will be auto-generated by the plugin.
If specified as an object, the following keys are supported: { n, e, s, w, ne, se, sw, nw }. The value of any specified should be a jQuery selector matching the child element of the resizable to use as that handle. If the handle is not a child of the resizable, you can pass in the DOMElement or a valid jQuery object directly.

option.name: helper
option.desc: This is the css class that will be added to a proxy element to outline the resize during the drag of the resize handle. Once the resize is complete, the original element is sized.

option.name: maxHeight
option.desc: This is the maximum height the resizable should be allowed to resize to.

option.name: maxWidth
option.desc: This is the maximum width the resizable should be allowed to resize to.

option.name: minHeight
option.desc: This is the minimum height the resizable should be allowed to resize to.

option.name: minWidth
option.desc: This is the minimum width the resizable should be allowed to resize to.

event.name: create
event.desc: This event is triggered when the resizable is created.

event.name: start
event.desc: This event is triggered at the start of a resize operation.

property.name: element
property.desc: The jQuery object representing the element to be resized

property.name: helper
property.desc: The jQuery object representing the helper that's being resized

property.name: originalElement
property.desc: The jQuery object representing the original element before it is wrapped

property.name: originalPosition
property.desc: The position represented as { left, top } before the resizable is resized

property.name: originalSize
property.desc: The size represented as { width, height } before the resizable is resized

property.name: position
property.desc: The current position represented as { left, top }

property.name: size
property.desc: The current size represented as { width, height }
